metadata.title: CVE-2016-7568 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the gdImageWebpCtx function in gd_webp.c in the GDGraphics Library (aka libgd) through 2.2.3, as used in PHP through 7.0.11,allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based bufferoverflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted imagewebpand imagedestroy calls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7568` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.5
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.5').
